isis.stitle: HENDRICKSON HN-460 SUSPENSION - REPLACE - BOLSTER SPRINGS

note.para: Replacement of individual bolster springs is possible from under vehicle without removing tires, rims or wheels.

step1.para: Remove the shock absorbers and the rebound spring.
Raise the frame enough to remove any loading into the bolster springs. Remove the upper bolster spring bolts, nuts and washers.
Raise the frame an additional 4". Remove the lower bolster spring bolts, nuts and washers.

Position the new bolster springs in the equalizing beam and install the lower bolts, nuts and washers. The bolt heads must be positioned at the rubber side of the springs. Tighten the locknuts to 33 to 45 ft-lbs. (45 to 61 N•m) as shown in Figure 25.

figure.caption: Figure 25. Installing Upper Bolster Spring Bolts

step1.para: Lower the frame until the saddle contacts the bolster springs.
Install the upper bolster spring bolts, nuts and washers. The bolt heads must be positioned at the rubber side of the springs. Tighten to 33 to 45 ft-lbs. (45 to 61 N•m) as shown in Figure 25.
Lower the frame and install the shock absorbers and the rebound spring.
